channel.title: Portforard a different computer?
channel.description: i have 3 computers in my house one in my room and two down stairs i wanna run rsps on my computer upstairs but do i portfoward the same way or do i need to go downstairs and do it on the computer thats hooked up to the router *note im dumb*

item.title: Portforard a different computer?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

teh genevoix:

[quote]Yes, you can portforward on any computer that is connected to the router, wifi or hardwired. Just go to the routers ip address. You just need the computer’s local ip address (it’d be an ip similar to the routers) that you want port forwarded.

so what do i need router ip or the computer that is hardwire to the routers ip?[/quote]
You need the routers IP and the IP of the computer that you want portforwarded.
On any computer connected to your internet (whether wifi or hardwired) and open your browser. Portforward as always (You seem like you’ve done it before).
Just use the IP of the computer you want forwarded, instead of the computer that is hardwired to the router.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforard a different computer?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If I understand correctly.

Yes, you can portforward on any computer that is connected to the router, wifi or hardwired. Just go to the routers ip address. You just need the computer’s local ip address (it’d be an ip similar to the routers) that you want port forwarded.

item.description:

You port forward on the computer you are running the server on.
